fields.description:
h3. Summary
Inline commenting a word that's also the title for a Code Block Macro isn't possible

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Page
# Add any word to it (e.g. "testing")
# Create a code block macro and set the title to be exactly equal to the word you've added.

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

# Publish the page
# Try to add an inline comment to the word "testing"

h3. Expected Results
You should be able to comment on that line.

h3. Actual Results
You are not able to comment and the following message is displayed:

*We can't add your inline comment; the section you highlighted may contain a macro or user mention. Try highlighting plain text.*

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workarounds
Change either the text on the Code Block Macro or the text outside of it.
fields.summary: Inline commenting a word that's also the title for a Code Block Macro isn't possible

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Customers who are viewing their Confluence Attachments through their Page's Attachment page ( ... > Attachments) are unable to add Comments to the files

h3. Environment
* Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add an attachment to a Confluence Page
# Navigate to the Attachments Page ( ... > Attachments) and View the Attachment
# Click on the Comment Bubble and drag it to a spot on the Attachment

h3. Expected Results
Comment sidebar loads and the User is able to add and publish a Comment

h3. Actual Results
The Comment Sidebar tries to load a broken RichText Editor rather than the typical WYSIWYG Editor; none of the buttons function: !OnPage-vs-Attachments.png|thumbnail! 

No errors are presented within Browser Console
 
h3. Notes
Tested with multiple different file types (PNG, PDF, Excel) and Comments could not be added if the Attachment was Viewed through the Page Attachments page

h3.Workaround
Embed the Attachment on the Page
fields.summary: Unable to Add Attachment Comments through Attachment Page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you have a code macro in a comment on a page and this macro is configured to have the expand/collapse option, after saving the comment the macro is automatically collapsed, but the option to expand it doesn't show up. This works while previewing the comment though.
h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud with the new look.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a page and add a comment
# On this comment add a Code block macro
# Edit the macro and set the "Collapsible" check box
# Save the comment

h3. Expected Results
The code block would have the "_Expand source_" link on its right side so we can expand it and see the code.
h3. Actual Results
The "_Expand source_" link isn't there.
 
h3. Notes
This works while previewing the comment and also work in the old look.
 !Comment.png|thumbnail!      !Preview.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Code macro doesn't expand when it's in a comment

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The *Search* text is not displayed when using IE 11. The search box is blanked by default unlike in other browsers where you see a grey *Search* displayed.

h3. Environment
* Internet Explorer 11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access the search using IE 11.

h3. Expected Results
*Search* is displayed in grey in the search box before inputting any text.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing is displayed and the search box is blank.
 
h3.Workaround
None.
It does not prevent users from using the search.
fields.summary: "Search" text is not displayed on Internet Explorer 11

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, when you navigate to Confluence as an Anonymous user through different spaces. When you click on the drop down list to show Recent Spaces history it will only show "All spaces" instead of the previous spaces you visited.

h3. Environment
Confluence 1000.0.0-57e69bf

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Allow Anonymous user access
# Create two spaces with anonymous access 
# Navigate to the two spaces as anonymous user
# Click on the drop down list to show Recent spaces history

h3. Expected Results
* Recent Spaces history should be populated for anonymous users

h3. Actual Results
* Recent Spaces history is not populated and it will only show "All spaces" option
 
h3. Notes
Recent Spaces history works fine for logged in users.
fields.summary: Recent Spaces history doesn't work for Anonymous Users

fields.description:
While trying to add JIRA filter in Confluence it gives timeout error.

Error from confluence log: java.lang.RuntimeException: com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.XhtmlTimeoutException: Rendering this content exceeded the timeout of 5 seconds.
 at com.atlassian.confluence.tinymceplugin.rest.MacroResource.generatePlaceHolder(MacroResource.java:166)
 at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor2987.invoke(Unknown Source)
 at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
 at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
fields.summary: While accessing JIRA filter in Confluence it fails with ERROR: Timeout while getting placeholder. Please try again shortly.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
With Confluence Server version Confluence 6.2.1, page version can be accessed using \{\{?pageVersion=1}}. But with Confluence Cloud, this functionality is not available

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the ability to link a specific page version using {{&pageversion=}}
fields.summary: Ability to link to a specific page version using &pageversion=

fields.description:
*Summary*

Currently, it's not possible to sort the table using date range in confluence.
fields.summary: Sort table using date range

fields.description:
h3. When Confluence is in German, macro browser for moving a page has floating text (Screenshots below)

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set Browser Language settings to German, or Confluence language settings to German. 
 # Attempt to move a page. In the macro browser window the text for new location will float out of the browser's frame.

h3. Expected Results 

Text should be rendered correctly.
h3. Actual Results 

Text floats out of the macro browser's frame. 
 !Screen Shot 2017-09-11 at 5.49.11 PM.png|thumbnail!

This doesn't happen in the English language version. 
 !Screen Shot 2017-09-11 at 5.37.02 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

No Workaround
fields.summary: Floating Text in Macro Browser when Confluence in German

fields.description:
Image thumbnails in questions and answers cannot be clicked any more in order to see them in full size.

*Workaround:*
# Click the image with the right mouse button
# Select "Open image" (Chrome), "View image" (Firefox), or "Show picture" (Internet Explorer)
fields.summary: Image thumbnails cannot be opened in larger size in Confluence Questions

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Outdent can cause unaligned indentation on Edit mode

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Page
# Create a Task then press Enter for a new line, input another task and repeat it again.
# After that, hit 'Shift + Tab' or click the 'Outdent' icon on the top bar.

h3. Expected Results
All tasks should be aligned on the same indentation.

h3. Actual Results
The line that was outdented is using a different spacing.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
Publishing the page actually makes the outdented line to lose its indentation.
fields.summary: Outdent can cause unaligned indentation on Edit mode

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The Contributors Summary Macro displays variable values for the "edits" value.

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
Confluence

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page in a space with a very-high level of activity
#  Add the Contributors Summary Macro to the page and set to display all contributions for the space
# Refresh the Macro over time (the issue displays best immediately following a content index)

h3. Expected Results

The Values given for the number of edits is accurate.

h3. Actual Results
The number of edits detected seems to fall out over time.
 
h3. Notes
N/A

h3.Workaround
There is currently no workaround.
fields.summary: Contributors Summary Macro displays incorrect values

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Confluence System Time isn't respecting the System Timezone offset that is currently configured individually for each application, meaning all Confluence Cloud applications across the globe are running with the same System Time, GMT.
This particularly breaks application links between Confluence Cloud and Server applications because of the problem described here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/APPLINKS061/OAuth+troubleshooting+guide#OAuthtroubleshootingguide-OAuthtimestamp

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Confluence Administration > System Information

h3. Expected Results
The System Time would be according to what the System Timezone offset would determine.
h3. Actual Results
The System Time is GMT for all applications.
fields.summary: Confluence System Time isn't respecting the System Timezone offset

fields.description:
h3. Problem
We can copy the content of cells in tables in Confluence, although we can't copy the entire cell, like on excel.

h3. Suggestion
Allow copying the entire cell

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Allow to Copy cells in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Users who have opted out of the [New Look|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/new-navigation-and-a-new-look-for-confluence-881536766.html] in Confluence are experiencing issues with navigating using the Spaces Menu bar or to other pages linked within Confluence

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud and Opted Out of New Look 
* Tested in Chrome and Firefox

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create/Edit a page and add a link to another page within the Same Instance
# Publish Page and Click on Link
or

# Navigate to a Space 
# Select another Space from the Space Menu bar
or

# Search for and click on a Page in the Quick Search 

h3. Expected Results
User is navigated to the new page

h3. Actual Results
Address Bar updates and shows the correct page URL however the page itself shows the initial page:
 !Greenshot 2017-09-11 12.51.35.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
The New Look for Confluence does not appear to be affected and navigates correctly

h3.Workaround
- Refresh the Page 
- Opt back in to the New Look for Confluence
fields.summary: Links to Confluence Page Do No Navigate With Old Look
Hard to Navigate

fields.description:
h3.Summary
When accessing Questions from the *Switch Apps* panel, you see a "Page Not Found" error

h3.Expected Results
Accessing from the Sidebar > Add-ons or from the *Switch Apps* panel, you should be able to use the Add-on.

h3.Actual Results
If you use the *Switch App* panel (or hamburguer icon) the following url is used:
{code}
https://instanceurl.atlassian.net/wiki/questions
{code}

And a *Page not Found* issue is displayed

But, if we access the Add-on from the Sidebar in *Add-ons*, the url displayed is the following:
{code}
https://instanceurl.atlassian.net/wiki/plugins/servlet/ac/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-questions/globalQuestionsViewer?user.key=xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx&user.id=some_user_name
{code}
_Note:_ Changed username and key for privacy.

And it works as expected...

----

Other issues related to the migration: 

h3.Previous Data
Other users are seeing issues where the data from before the migration is no longer accessible, but if they create new Questions, there is no issues.

h3.Attachments and Files
And, lastly but not least, some users are not able to open attachments and files on the Questions after the migration.

h3.Loading Issues
In some of the instances customers are not able to load the Questions page, neither the *Topics* or *Experts* pages. They are presented with the following error on the Console:
{code}
app.js:1 Error:  Error: Unexpected failure
{code}

And:
{code}
Request URL:https://confluence-questions.prod.atl-paas.net/rest/questions-connect/1.0/expert?start=0&limit=10
{code}
fields.summary: Questions for Confluence not working properly after migration

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a page is created with a title starting with a !@#$ character that page does not show under !@#$ in the page index macro.
h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Put a page index macro on a page
# Create a page starting with one of these characters {noformat}!@#$  {noformat}
h3. Expected Results
The page would be listed under the heading: !@#$
h3. Actual Results
The page does not show under any header on the page index macro results.
h3. Notes
Please see screen shot

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround.
fields.summary: Page index macro does not display pages that start with !@#$ under !@#$ heading

fields.description:
h3.The Issue
Some instances when utilizing Jira Issues Macro, are not able to render the issues on the page. At first, it seems like an permission error where Confluence is not able to display the issues due to the wrong permissions being set, but even with all due permissions the issue persists. 

h3.Log Messages
We are able to see the following lines of warning in the logs every time we open a page that is facing the issue:
{code}
WARN: com.atlassian.oauth.serviceprovider.internal.AuthenticatorImpl 
Problem encountered authenticating OAuth 1.0 client for url "https://INSTANCEURL/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/temp/SearchRequest.xml", error was "consumer_key_unknown", with parameters "{oauth_problem=consumer_key_unknown}"
{code}

h3. Workaround
The issue is usually due to a broken Application Link. Please contact Atlassian Support (by logging a support request in [support.atlassian.com|https://support.atlassian.com]) to have the application links reset.
fields.summary: Jira Issues Macro not able to retrieve Jira's metadata

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, adding 'Show Comments count' on the "Content Report Table" macro configuration would show all the count of comments in the labeled page including 'resolved comments'.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be better if only unresolved comments should be counted not including the resolved comments. Or provide an option to choose to show the count of unresolved comments and resolved comments.

Additionally, when comments are internal, it should not display the counting to anonymous users.
fields.summary: Show only counts of unresolved comments in Content Report Table macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Ability to log in automatically to multiple instances using a different email address on same browser session.
* Have an option to change the email address that saved on browser session.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to the login page.
# Login to the instance with a username.
# Save username and password on the browser.
# Change the username email address.
# Login automatically to the instance.

h3. Expected Results
* After change the email address, able to login automatically to the instance.

h3. Actual Results
* Different instance with different email address need to log in using different browser session.

h3.Workaround
* Register a same email username on multiple instances.
fields.summary: Ability to log in automatically to multiple instances using a different email address on same browser session.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Copying a page which contains a lot of attachments linked to it results in a time out.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use the *Copy* option on a page that has more than 180 attachments linked to it.

h3. Expected Results

The editor opens up with the page properly copied.
h3. Actual Results

The copy request responds with a 500 and the operation results in a time out:
|!Confluence-Page-unavailable.png|thumbnail!|

*Notes*:
 * It is also faced when we try to move a page to another space.

h3. Workaround
 * *Sometimes*, after the operation times out, the draft for the copy might be located under *Recently worked on* so it can be edited and published from there.
 * Otherwise, the alternative workaround is to split the page into multiple smaller pages that can be copied without problems.
fields.summary: Copying a page with a high number of attachments (180+) results in a time out.

fields.description:
Hi,
I received a requirement from our media company that requesting us to insert the code (Xaxis 3rd party pixel) below into all Anmum Malaysia pages (English and BM site). Our plan would be to add this on either template level or global page level configuration, but we’ve checked the template is shared across all countries. Can you help to check with us, how can we solve this case and successfully insert the pixel? Is it require to have template change?  

Below are information of the pixels:

*Implementing Directly on a Website :* The entire contents of the above script should be placed between the ‹body›‹/body› tags of every page which you want tracked. Ideally, it will be placed before the closing ‹/body› tag, and should be included on all pages. This tag may be used on secure and non-secure pages, since it includes a check for page protocol.   Kindly find Xaxis 3rd party pixel to be implemented on all pages for https://www.anmum.com/my

*Code To Implement*
<!-- Lightning Bolt Begins -->    
  <script type="text/javascript">        
  var lbTrans = '[TRANSACTION ID]';        
  var lbValue = '[TRANSACTION VALUE]';        
  var lbData = '[Attribute/Value Pairs for Custom Data]';    
</script>    
<script type="text/javascript" id="lightning_bolt" src="//cdn-akamai.mookie1.com/LB/LightningBolt.js"></script>    
<!-- Lightning Bolt Ends -->       

Hear from you soon.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When clicking on the "View" button of a .docx file which was uploaded to a Confluence page, the application is not able to preview it.
h3. Environment
Cloud - Confluence 1000.1953.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Upload a .docx file to a Confluence page
# Go to the attachment page
# Click on "View"

h3. Expected Results
The .docx file should be displayed
h3. Actual Results
Not able to preview file, only download it.
 
h3.Workaround
Use office connector on the Confluence page.
fields.summary: Not able to preview docx files

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Customers who are using the Create from Template macro on their pages are receiving an HTTP 404 Error when they try to create a page from a template
h3. Environment
 * Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page and add a Create from Template Macro
 # On the "Title of the page to be created" field, specify a title which contains a colon ':' , eg "Review For: "
 # Save Macro and Publish Page
 # Try to click on Create from Template button shown on the page

h3. Expected Results

Confluence Editor appears and allows the user to edit the page
h3. Actual Results

Browser loads a 404 Error; browser console shows:
{noformat}
createpage-entervariables.action Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 404 (){noformat}
h3. Notes
 - The template can be created directly by clicking on the Create Button and selecting their appropriate template

h3. Workaround

Edit the Macro and remove the Colon Character from the "Title of the page to be created" field

 

Update from [~ktreewatchararat]

I can reproduce the bug when using a custom template which includes at least one variable. And there is a colon ":" in the field "Title of the page to be created"
fields.summary: Unable to Create from Template if Title Field has a Colon

fields.description:
h3.The Issue
On Windows systems, when creating a table and inputting a Date field, the Date block is cut.

h3.Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Page
# Create a Table with Side-Headers
# Input a Date Field ("//")
# Publish the Page

h3.Expected Results
The Table will render the full block
 !right.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Actual Results
The block is cut
 !broken.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Date Fields in Table Cells cut on Windows

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Sorting completed tasks by "Completed On" within the user profile doesn't respect the completion date order. It seems that it first sort by page name and then by date.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add tasks on a few pages and assign to a user
# Go to the user's profile Tasks page
# Select "Assigned to me" and "Complete"
# Click on the "Completed on" column to sort it

h3. Expected Results
Tasks are sorted according their completion date
h3. Actual Results
Tasks are not sorted according the their completion dates. See attachments screenshot where there's a task completed on September 6 in the middle of tasks completed on September 8.
 !Screen Shot 2017-09-08 at 15.14.30.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
There must be tasks on different pages, pages with different names, otherwise if all tasks are within the same page then the error isn't noticeable as the sorting error appears to be related to the page name.

h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Sorting completed tasks doesn't respect completed date

fields.description:
h3. Summary

There is no Confluence *session* endpoint to be called for cookie authentication as the one for JIRA documented in:
- [Cookie-based auth for REST APIs|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/jira-rest-api-cookie-based-authentication/]

h3. Workaround

If you have JIRA and Confluence on the same instance then you can call the JIRA session endpoint and, if the credentials used to authenticate the request have Confluence application access, you can use the cookie you retrieved to authenticate Confluence REST API calls.
fields.summary: It would be nice to have a session endpoint to call for Cookie authentication in Confluence as well

fields.description:
h3. Summary

With the old Confluence look, when you create a page and publish it, the page URL pattern will change to the new page created but the page content view will be the previous page created.
h3. Environment

Confluence 1000.0.0-eb540d3
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page 1 with page title: Navigation
 # Access another space and create page 2 with page title: new page

h3. Expected Results

Once page 2 is created the page URL is correct but the page content view will be the page 1
h3. Actual Results

Once page 2 is created the page URL and page content should be the page 2 not the previous page
fields.summary: Confluence navigation is not working properly

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The *Drafts* menu does not show the new message that drafts are now located in the *Recently worked on* menu.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the *Drafts* menu by clicking on your profile picture then *Drafts*.

h3. Expected Results
The following message is displayed:
{noformat}You can now find your drafts in Recently Worked On.{noformat}

h3. Actual Results
The following message is displayed:
{noformat}
When you edit a page but don't publish the changes, a draft is created. Hit Resume to continue editing or publish the changes.
{noformat}
 
h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Drafts menu does not display the message that drafts are now in Recently Worked On menu

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When an anonymous user access an open Confluence space, one of the options introduced for the sidebar is the spaces drop down. When they click on this option, Confluence will refresh the page in order to show the spaces, however, this action will prompt the user with a login window, avoiding the anonymous user to continue using the instance, unless the same manually refreshes the browser to continue navigating:

!spaces.png|thumbnail!


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure Confluence to have [anonymous access enabled|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/setting-up-public-access-156.html]
# Access the instance as an anonymous user
# Click on the space name, on the sidebar, which should provide you a dropdown with a space list
# The user will be prompt to login

h3. Expected Results
The anonymous user should be able to continue navigating without needing to login, since the anonymous user access is enabled
h3. Actual Results
The same will be required to login in the instance 

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Login Prompt for Anonymous Users When Clicking on Spaces Dropdown

fields.description:

# Create a page in this space, so it will be displayed on Service Desk
# Click on the link for the KB article in Service Desk. For example, you can try to click on the link from a comment in Confluence

h3. Expected Results
It should be displaying the breadcrumbs/path to where the KB is from.
h3. Actual Results
An "Undefined" text is displayed at the top of the page
 
h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: "Undefined" Message While Linking Service Desk and Confluence

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Link a JIRA Service Desk project to a Space
# Create a page on that space with a [Table of Contents|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/table-of-contents-macro-724765294.html] macro
# back to Service Desk, navigate to the page with the Table of Contents macro

PDF Macro throws error on Preview Mode

h3. Steps to Reproduce

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When connecting JIRA Service Desk with Confluence, customers without Confluence access will not be able to click on the links of the Page Tree macro or use its search, as they will not be licensed/permitted to login at Confluence, and when trying it, it will give a *Permission Denied* message. 

When trying to click on the page links rendered by the macro on the Service Desk KB, it will redirect them to the Confluence page URLs (https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SPACEKEY/pages/pageid/page+name), instead of the customer KB URL (https://example.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/kb/view/pageid). If trying to use the search of the macro, it will use Confluence's search URL (https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/plugins/pagetreesearch/pagetreesearch.action) as well. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Link a JIRA Service Desk project to a Space
# Create a page on that space with a [Page Tree macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/page-tree-macro-724765260.html]
# Login as a Service Desk customer (user without Confluence Application access)
# Still on the Service Desk side, navigate to the page with the Page Tree macro
# Try to click on any of the page links or hit the *Search* button.

h3. Expected Results
The links should redirect the customer to the Service Desk KB page.
h3. Actual Results
It redirects the user to Confluence, stating a *Permission Denied* message. 
h3. Notes
Still on the KB article side of Service Desk, an additional BUG can be observed if trying to use the function to *expand* the page to display its child pages, it will open a new tab with the page content. In the KB it will state that the expand action is *loading*, but, no page will be retrieved. 

When trying to confirm the behavior with different macros, it's confirmed that the [Content by Label macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/content-by-label-macro-145566.html] does not reproduce the same issue. The mechanism used to render the page links of this macro could help on fixing the Page Tree issue.

h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Page Tree Macro Issues with Service Desk

fields.summary: Add the ability to search for spaces on Confluence Mobile

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Incorrect behaviour when a child's page restriction is changed due to granting access to a user.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* There are 2 users, User A and User B.
* Create 2 pages; a parent page and a child page, Page A and Page B respectively.
* Restriction on Page A is such that only User A has access.
* There are no restrictions on Page B.

# User B requests access on Page B; an email is sent to the Confluence admin.
# The Confluence admin grants access to User B.

h3. Expected Results
User B should not be able to access Page B as the parent's (Page A) restrictions prohibits it. User A should still have access to Page B.

h3. Actual Results
* The restriction on Page B changes from _unrestricted_ to allow access to +only+ User B.
* User B still cannot access Page B as the parent page disallows it.  However, User A has no access to Page B.

This is an issue as all users who had access to a child page are now disallowed.
fields.summary: Incorrect behaviour in page restrictions
Space Import fails due to setting incorrect Bandana context

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Gallery macro with style macro makes the preview on gallery macro is not working.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Create attachment page.
2. Attach images on the attachment page. Label the image with "test" label.
3. Create gallery page.
4. Insert gallery macro on the gallery page. 
5. Fill the Include Images with these Labels Only with the "test" label and filled in Use Images in these Pages text box to the attachment page.
6. Insert style macro and put the CSS code
 .confluence-embedded-image \{width:200px !important; height:auto !important;} 
7. Publish page.

h3. Expected Results
* When the user clicks the image the preview image is pop up.

h3. Actual Results
* When the user clicks the image the pop up is not showing.

h3.Workaround
* Move the style macro on the gallery page.

Error message from browser console:
* Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'get' of null
* Uncaught Error: undefined missing ac/confluence/macro/property-panel-controls

fields.description:
h3. Summary

With the introduction of [Confluence's new look|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/new-navigation-and-a-new-look-for-confluence-881536766.html], while working with [Tasks|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf56/working-with-tasks-658736982.html] or the [Task Report|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/task-report-macro-724765319.html] macros, Confluence no longer changes the color for the task once it's overdue or breaching the mentioned date. From the screenshot below, we can see an example of how it worked previously:

!task.png|thumbnail|!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# *Edit* a page in Confluence
# On the editor, either add a new task (through the task options in the top editor menu) or add the *Task Report* macro, from the *Other macros* option.
# Make sure to add a date that will be either overdue or breached
# Save the page

h3. Expected Results

"If a task is nearing, or has passed its due date, the colour of the date will change (red for overdue, orange for due in the next 7 days)."

h3. Actual Results
The color keeps the same. 

h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Date Colors No Longer Working with Tasks

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When creating JIRA Issues from a table that contains merged cells, the wrong items will be selected for the *Summary*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Attempt to create JIRA Issues from a Confluence table including merged cells.

h3. Expected Results
The JIRA Issues are created using the text from the selected column as *Summary*.

h3. Actual Results
Rows are ignored after the 1st one next to a merged cell and Confluence is using the next column on the right to populate *Summary* for JIRA Issue creation.

h6. Table format
 !Screen Shot 2017-09-06 at 09.25.14.png|thumbnail! 

h6. Multiple JIRA Issue creation from that same table
 !Screen Shot 2017-09-06 at 09.25.32.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Unmerge the cell before creating JIRA Issues from the table and remerge them afterwards.
fields.summary: Multiple JIRA Issue creation does not work properly with merged cells

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When inserting a Jira Issue Calendar on a Confluence page (With all due permissions of access/administer/browser for the user on Jira's project), the issues are not rendered on the calendar. The calendar is displayed as below:
 !Screen Shot 2017-09-05 at 3.37.50 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Project in Jira and set all permissions
 # In Confluence, create a new Page
 # Insert a *Jira Issues Calendar*
 # Point the Calendar to the Project (You can set any filter, or Due Date)
 # Save the changes
 # Publish the Page

h3. Expected Behavior

The issues would be rendered and you would be able to check the due dates, or any other information you've set previously while editing the calendar.
h3. Actual results

When reloading the page, if you open the Console from the Browser's inspect mode, you can see the following Exception:
 !Screen Shot 2017-09-05 at 3.36.36 PM.png|thumbnail!

"Uncaught Error: undefined missing ac/confluence/macro/property-panel-controls"

When the calendar is rendered, it is completely empty and does not display any of the issues, regardless of the project.
h3. Environment

*Confluence Version*: Confluence 1000.0.0-98b0a79
fields.summary: Jira Issues Calendar not rendering issues

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 # It's not possible to manage the labels for an Overview page (Space home page) in page view.
 # When editing an Overview page, it's possible to add new labels via the *More actions...* menu, but there's no visual indication of the current labels and no ability to remove labels.

!from-add-labels-screen-in-edit-mode.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide the ability to add and remove labels when viewing the Overview page.
 When editing an Overview page, provide a way to review the current labels and remove labels.
h3. Workaround 
 * It's possible to view the current labels by going to Page Information.

 !image-2021-06-18-10-46-47-026.png|thumbnail!

 * Add new labels to a page in Edit mode under the *More actions...* menu
 * To remove labels, temporarily set a different page to be the Space Overview (Home page), remove the label, and set the page back again.
fields.summary: Provide ability to manage labels on space Overview page view

1000.0.0-cd79d9f

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Add excel or word document as an attachment

{code}
https://<Base URL>/wiki/spaces/KS0/pages/12845057/Test+Page+C
{code}

The URL should not have the digits (e.g. 12845057) displayed.

As mentioned above.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When adding a page tree macro and setting the root page as *@none* the macro does not load the child pages.
h3. !page_tree_macro_01.png|thumbnail!                           !page_tree_macro_02.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a page tree macro to a page in a space with a few pages (some need to be orphan and have child pages as well)
 # Set the root page to @none in the page tree macro
 # Set the Start Depth to 2 or a higher number

h3. Expected Results

Page tree displayed with all pages (including the orphan ones) and its child pages.
h3. Actual Results

Only the parent pages are displayed.
h3. Workaround
 * Move all pages under the home page, leaving none orphaned;
 * create the page tree macro setting the root page as @home.
fields.summary: Page tree macro does not load if the root page is set to @none

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Deleted Spaces still appearing under 'Recent' in App Switcher

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Space
# View some pages on it
# Delete the Space
# Go to App Switcher

h3. Expected Results
Under 'Recent', only recently accessed and existing spaces should appear.

h3. Actual Results
Under 'Recent', recently accessed but no longer existing spaces still appear.
fields.summary: Deleted Spaces still appearing under 'Recent' in App Switcher

fields.description: While editing large pages with multiple expand macro on the page, it becomes very difficult to manage page scrolling up and down. There should be a way or option to minimize or collapse expand macro while editing the page.
fields.summary: minimize button / option for expand macro when editing the page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user tries to access a Confluence page that they don't have access to, they are directed to '404 Oops, you've found a dead link' error instead of a Permission Denied or a more useful error. This also affects Anonymous users who don't have access to a page and Anonymous access is enabled in the instance.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page and add Page Restriction to the page
# Let a user who doesn't have access to the page to access the direct URL of the page created on Step 1

h3. Expected Results
* It should provide a Permission denied error or a more useful error. For anonymous, a login prompt, so the same will be aware that access is needed for the page.

h3. Actual Results
* User is directed to '404 Oops, you've found a dead link' error
fields.summary: 404 error instead of login screen when anonymous users try to access restricted content

fields.description:

Index: 0, Size: 0

Confluence 1000.1915.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Select 'Ask Question' template

h3. Expected Results

Actual Results

fields.summary: Unable to create Ask Question template

fields.description:
Include a customisation option within the sidebar to remove "Pages."

This request relates to the suggestion to re-introduce the page tree as a persistent nav item in the space sidebar: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-56841

 
----
{panel:title=Original Request}
h3. Summary
Option to remove Pages and Blog from sidedbar

h3. Description
With the new confluence layout, we unable to customize the sidebar to remove pages, blog, Gliffy link.
{panel}
fields.summary: Option to remove Pages from sidebar

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Confluence Page Tree Macro causes additional whitespace to be added between the content and the Comments section. There is also a larger than normal gap added above the macro.

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page
# Add the Page Tree Macro to that page 

h3. Expected Results

The Content only takes up the needed space.

h3. Actual Results

There is a large amount of whitespace that is added between the content and the comments at the bottom. In addition, there is a smaller amount of additional whitespace added above the macro.
 
h3. Notes
=== Without Macro in Page===
 !Without Macro.png|thumbnail!
===

=== With Macro in page===
 !With Macro.png|thumbnail! 
=== 

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround at this time.
fields.summary: Page Tree Macro creates additional whitespace/padding between content and comments

fields.description:
h3. Summary
We're unable to add/change labels on Attachments within Space Tools > Content Tools > Attachments
h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud with the new look.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Space Tools > Content Tools > Attachments
# Click the pencil sign under the Labels column

h3. Expected Results
You should be able to add labels to the attachments.
h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens when you click the pencil sign, and if you're scrolled down to the bottom of the page, when you click the pencil sign it scrolls you up to the top of the page.

h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Unable to add/change attachments labels

fields.description:
h3. Summary

WHen inserting a link to an attachment on another page, when the current page has a {{Style Macro}}, you are not able to preview the files, and is either prompt with an error, or nothing happens.

The error in question is the following:

!error.png|thumbnail!

Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Page
 # Insert a Link using the *Search* functionality from the Link Panel to point to an attachment in a different page
 # Insert a Section Macro (it can be empty) anywhere on the page

h3. Expected Behavior

The file would preview.
h3. Actual Behavior

It does not open the preview pane, or when it opens, there's the error above.

_Note_: This only happens in the new layout.
fields.summary: Images are not previewing when Style Macro is on a page (New Layout)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After installing a font supporting Persian characters, PDf exports do include these characters however, additional spaces are added when characters should be connected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install a font supporting Persian characters.
# Export a page as PDF.

h3. Expected Results
The PDf export renders the characters properly.

h3. Actual Results
Additional spaces are added between characters on the resulting PDF.
 
h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Persian characters are rendered improperly in PDF exports

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When editing a page and attempting to insert a macro, the macro modal window takes more than 20 seconds to appear.
If the editor is kept open, the macro modal window will be displayed as usual once it has been opened once.
If the editor is closed and re-opened, the same behaviour happens (+20 seconds to display).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a page.
# Use the insert *Other macros*

h3. Expected Results
The macro modal window is displayed properly and fast.

h3. Actual Results
The macro modal window takes at least 20 seconds to display, sometimes not displaying at all.
 
h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Macro modal window degraded performance

fields.description: I can see that you have included week number in the team calendars week view. This is great! However please also include week number in the timeline view. We use this as our "gant diagram" and we miss the possibility to see week numbers in this view.
fields.summary: Display week number in Team Calendars Timeline view

fields.description:
Related to persistence in notify watchers:

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-5-8-release-notes-744325370.html#Confluence5.8ReleaseNotes-Smallimprovementswithabigimpact]

My customer is using the Clone Spaces functionality to use one space as template to create others for new JIRA Cloud projects.

When importing the downloaded space used as template, the disabled "notify watchers for the pages" is lost and the new space keeps the notify watchers checked wich is not desired by default.
fields.summary: Persistent "Disabled notify watchers" when exporting space.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Based on the [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/workbox-notifications-724765365.html]. The notification will appears as "read" if you've already viewed the page or blog post.

{quote}
The notifications dialog does not show notifications triggered because you're watching a space. Only watches on pages and blog posts are relevant here.
The notification appears as "read" if you've already viewed the page or blog post.
{quote}



h3. Steps to replicate

# Mention another user in any confluence page
# Ask the user to check his workbox and click on the notification, then click open.
#* User will be redirected to the page
# Once you visited the page, click on workbox.


h3. Observed Behaviour

!not.png|thumbnail!


h3. Expected Behaviour

There should be *read* message telling we have viewed it.
fields.summary: Notifications are not marked as read

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The first attempt to edit a macro or use the Macro Browser can take more than 20 seconds to load the Dialog.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Browse to any Confluence page and Edit to bring up the editor
# from the dropdown "+" menu, select "other macros" to open the macro browser, or double-click an existing macro while editing a page to open the edit modal for this macro

h3.Workaround

fields.summary: Editing Macros and Macro Browser Load slow in editor

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When site administrators create a site export of Confluence Cloud to import into a server instance, they find that the column {{credential}} in the \{\{{{cwd_user}}}}  table is NULL.

This poses major issues for users trying to migrate from Confluence Cloud to server, because Admins and normal users are unable to login to the new server instance. This issue is a spinoff of -CONFCLOUD-52260-, however, the issue is more widespread than the {{sysadmin}} user being unable to login - *all* users are unable to login because they have no password set.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud version: 1000.1903.0
 * Confluence Server Version: 6.2.1 and above

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Confluence Cloud site backup following [Create a site backup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/create-a-site-backup-724765526.html]
 # Spin up a Confluence 6.2.1 or above Confluence Server instance with an external database of your choice
 # Restore the backup created in Step 1 into the Confluence Server instance.

h3. Expected Results

Users, (including the {{sysadmin}}) should be able to login. Their Usernames and Passwords should be migrated over to the new database with the XML export.
h3. Actual Results

No users are able to login. When looking at the output of {{select * from cwd_user;}}, you can see that there are no entries under the *credential* column for any user.
h3. Workaround

Currently the only workaround is to regain admin rights to the instance, set up the Confluence email service for the stand alone instance, and then have users follow the password reset link on the login page to reset their passwords. Please see below for exact workaround instructions:
 # Follow [Restore Passwords to Recover Admin User Rights|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/restore-passwords-to-recover-admin-user-rights-158390.html]
 # Once you are logged into Confluence standalone, you'll want to [Configure a Server for Outgoing mail|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configuring-a-server-for-outgoing-mail-151078.html].
 # Once you have configured the mail server, please have users reset their passwords using the *Forgot Password?* link on the login page.
fields.summary: XML Site Backup Does not Export User Credentials

fields.description:

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When embedding videos from Vimeo using the Widget Connector, the fullscreen button is not available on the new Interface of Confluence

h3. Environment
Cloud - Confluence 1000.0.0-70ae3c7

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Get to a Confluence page
# Edit the page and add the Widget Connector macro, use a link from a Vimeo video.
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
The fullscreen button should be available, as on the old Confluence UI

h3. Actual Results
Fullscreen button removed.
 
h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Fullscreen mode not available for Vimeo

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you insert an image into a page and apply an image effect, the image with effect is not updating if you upload an image with the same file name.

h3. Environment
Confluence 1000.0.0-70ae3c7

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page
# Insert an image into the page, set the size to 'Original' and apply an effect to the image
# Insert the image again, set the size to 'Original'. Do not replace the first image. Do not apply an effect to this image
# Save the page. (Two images are displayed, one with image effect and one without image effect)
# Edit the image file using a file editor. Do not change the file name
# Add the updated image to the page, either by dragging and dropping it onto the page or via the Attachments page ('Attachments' in the ... menu).

h3. Expected Results
* Both images should be updated when an updated image is uploaded with the same file name.

h3. Actual Results
* The image with effect is not updated and does not display the edited image when an updated is uploaded with the same file name.
fields.summary: Images with effects are not updating

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If the *Share a link* blueprint is modified, the automatically added *panel* macro allowing to display a preview of the link will not be added.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Modify the *Share a link* blueprint in *Global Templates and Blueprints* menu
# Create a page using the *Share a link* blueprint.

h3. Expected Results
The page is created and the *panel* macro is properly added and populated.

h3. Actual Results
The *panel* macro is not added and the page appears blank.
 
h3.Workaround
None. Reset the *Share a link* blueprint to default if you need the *panel* macro to be added.
fields.summary: If the Share a link blueprint is modified, the additional panel to preview the link is no longer added

fields.description:
h4. Problem
https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-disable-commenting-on-an-individual-page-695107603.html?_ga=2.217992662.1784361974.1504081500-114356736.1503484522 mentions using HTML Macro although appears to be listed under Confluence Cloud solutions. HTML Macro is a restricted function in Cloud and is not possible to enable it.

h4. Suggested Solution
Remove this article from our Cloud documentation. It is not possible to disable comments on a per-page basis in Cloud Confluence.
fields.summary: Documentation incorrectly suggests use of HTML Macro which is a restricted function

fields.description:
h3.Summary
Task List export for Word and PDF are not rendered properly. 

h3.Steps to reproduce
# Input a Task List/Action item onto a page
# Export page to Word or PDF
# Download the file if PDF
# Open it

h3.Expected Results
An export of the page as it is rendered on Confluence (Full Task-list, both done and not done tasks).

h3.Actual Results
* In Word, a badly rendered table with bullet points and missing the tasks marked as done.
* In the new editor, the tasks/action items are converted to bullet points only.
* In PDF, missing the tasks that were marked as done.
fields.summary: Page Export with Task List (Word/PDF)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Individual Users Global Permissions are migrated but not editable on instances imported from Server

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On a Confluence Server instance, grant Global Permissions as "Confluence Administrator" for a Single User.
# Do a Confluence Site Backup
# On a Confluence-only Cloud instance, import the backup file as a 'Site Import'
# Once the import is finished, to to *Global Permissions*

h3. Expected Results
Either the Individual User Global Permissions should be discarded or the administrator should be able to edit/remove it.

h3. Actual Results
The Individual User permissions are migrated over from Server, however it is not possible to edit or remove them.

h3. Example

 !permissions.png!
fields.summary: Individual Users Global Permissions are migrated but not editable on instances imported from Server

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Change the left sidebar appearance when exporting the space.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to space tools on the space > Content Tools > Export
# Export space.

h3. Expected Results
* On the left sidebar showing the page tree of the space.

h3. Actual Results
* On the left sidebar showing the Confluence Home view.

h3.Workaround
* No Workaround.

h3.Why is this important?
* When needs to correcting the document and exporting again as we need to open the new tab in the browser.
fields.summary: Change the left sidebar appearance when exporting the space

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Show the Space Tools link on every page on the space and give the ability to do customization in the left sidebar.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to overview page on the space(have the Space Tools link)
# Go to any child pages on the space(don't have the Space Tools link)

h3. Expected Results
* Have the Space Tools link on every page on the space.

h3. Actual Results
* The Space Tools link only available on the overview page on the space.

h3.Workaround
* No Workaround.

h3.Why is this important?
* It's complicated to navigate to overview page first to open the Space Tools link.
fields.summary: Show the Space Tools link on every page on the space and give the ability to do customization in the left sidebar
